description:
Example 1:
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	available	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
#  INSTANCE=`euca-run-instances ami-000000f0 --key mykey | awk '/^INSTANCE/ {print $2}'` ; euca-attach-volume -i $INSTANCE vol-00000019 -d /dev/sdh ; euca-terminate-instances $INSTANCE
VOLUME	vol-00000019
INSTANCE	i-0000005e

# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	attaching	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	in-use	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
ATTACHMENT	vol-00000019	i-0000005e	/dev/sdh	attached	
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	in-use	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
ATTACHMENT	vol-00000019	i-0000005e	/dev/sdh	attached	
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
InstanceNotFound: Instance i-0000005e could not be found.

Example 2:
# INSTANCE=`euca-run-instances ami-000000f0 --key mykey | awk '/^INSTANCE/ {print $2}'` ;  euca-attach-volume -i $INSTANCE `euca-create-volume -z nova -s 1 | awk '{print $2}'` -d /dev/sdh ; euca-terminate-instances $INSTANCE
VOLUME	vol-0000001c
INSTANCE	i-0000005b
euca-describe-volumes vol-0000001c
InstanceNotFound: Instance i-0000005b could not be found.

I cannot remove the volumes from cinder.
I cannot tell him, the instance not exists any more.

Additional Note:
Looks like when the volume not "available" before attachment I got an error message, but the result is the same it tries to attach it anyway.

Version:
openstack-cinder-2012.2-1.fc18
openstack-nova-api-2012.2-1.fc18.
title: Instance termination while attaching causes wrong volume-status

comments.content:
Example 1:
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	available	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
#  INSTANCE=`euca-run-instances ami-000000f0 --key mykey | awk '/^INSTANCE/ {print $2}'` ; euca-attach-volume -i $INSTANCE vol-00000019 -d /dev/sdh ; euca-terminate-instances $INSTANCE
VOLUME	vol-00000019
INSTANCE	i-0000005e

# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	attaching	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	in-use	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
ATTACHMENT	vol-00000019	i-0000005e	/dev/sdh	attached	
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
VOLUME	vol-00000019	 1		nova	in-use	2012-11-15T11:20:17.447640
ATTACHMENT	vol-00000019	i-0000005e	/dev/sdh	attached	
# euca-describe-volumes vol-00000019
InstanceNotFound: Instance i-0000005e could not be found.

Example 2:
# INSTANCE=`euca-run-instances ami-000000f0 --key mykey | awk '/^INSTANCE/ {print $2}'` ;  euca-attach-volume -i $INSTANCE `euca-create-volume -z nova -s 1 | awk '{print $2}'` -d /dev/sdh ; euca-terminate-instances $INSTANCE
VOLUME	vol-0000001c
INSTANCE	i-0000005b
euca-describe-volumes vol-0000001c
InstanceNotFound: Instance i-0000005b could not be found.

I cannot remove the volumes from cinder.
I cannot tell him, the instance not exists any more.

Additional Note:
Looks like when the volume not "available" before attachment I got an error message, but the result is the same it tries to attach it anyway.

Version:
openstack-cinder-2012.2-1.fc18
openstack-nova-api-2012.2-1.fc18.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content:
Not just EC2.

# nova boot --image 72c277a8-a902-4659-acf9-64b2ad8bd782  --flavor 1 test
# nova volume-attach test 04a5f6f7-f62e-4fa3-a786-2f1f1ad4d1fe /dev/vdh ; nova delete test
# cinder show 04a5f6f7-f62e-4fa3-a786-2f1f1ad4d1fe

#nova list
Empty

#cinder show 04a5f6f7-f62e-4fa3-a786-2f1f1ad4d1fe
Says in-use
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content: What release are you using? What do the logs on the nova-compute node for that instance say when you attempt this?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mikal

comments.content:
My installation is based on the md5:598760ce72f391d3bb6a6ea2c9218fcf nova-2012.2.tar.gz  https://launchpad.net/nova/folsom/2012.2/+download/nova-2012.2.tar.gz.

I can reproduce the issue, but I can't see  any error message which is common in both attempts.
Post issue query errors are not too interesting.

This looks the most relevant, but I do not  see it always:
compute.log:2012-11-16 22:20:54 ERROR nova.compute.manager [req-65f64191-5261-4c0b-b6ab-58263deabbc4 b10737d06c01483c91402224ebd05bd1 f8d9f028b55545b8959d8e955b6fcfde] [instance: 3ec84511-99db-42da-a8e9-e71d3f57482c] Build error: ['Traceback (most recent call last):\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 496, in _run_instance\n    injected_files, admin_password)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 754, in _spawn\n    launched_at=timeutils.utcnow())\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/compute/manager.py", line 255, in _instance_update\n    context, instance_uuid, kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/api.py", line 681, in instance_update_and_get_original\n    values)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 129, in wrapper\n    return f(*args, **kwargs)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 1815, in instance_update_and_get_original\n    copy_old_instance=True)\n', '  File "/usr/lib/python2.7/site-packages/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py", line 1835, in _instance_update\n    expected=expected)\n', "UnexpectedTaskStateError: unexpected task state: expecting ('spawning',) but the actual state is deleting\n"]

The timing is important.


I can make a volume stall  in detaching state ->  not deletable instances -> not deletable  security groups. 

Some message looks relevant:
libvirtError: Requested operation is not valid: cannot do live update a device on inactive domain
...
 ProcessExecutionError: Unexpected error while running command.
2012-11-16 12:29:52 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp Command: sudo nova-rootwrap /etc/nova/rootwrap.conf iscsiadm -m node -T iqn.2010-10.org.openstack:volume-bd3f7627-f9f0-42e3-b04a-cced0f7ed012 -p 192.168.84.100:3260 --op update -n node.startup -v manual
2012-11-16 12:29:52 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp Exit code: 21
2012-11-16 12:29:52 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp Stdout: ''
2012-11-16 12:29:52 TRACE nova.openstack.common.rpc.amqp Stderr: 'iscsiadm: No records found\n'

I can upload a full network  traffic of the machine during the event. I can create postgresql dump. I can upload all logs.

I'll  try to reproduce it with latest stable/folsom git first.

If I can't find  root cause within 4 days, I'll upload almost everything.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas

comments.content:
Looks like the mentioned issues not happens with 803a05b7b38f1b457af80c4136105ce8804ecff7 version.
This was the latest stable/folsom.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~afazekas
